intro: Eremopoa altaica, commonly known as the Altai eremopoa, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions. Eremopoa altaica plays a minor ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to soil stabilization and providing forage for local wildlife.
